pullRequest.title: Add ExtensionSchemaAnnotationHandler
pullRequest.bodyText:
Add ExtensionSchemaAnnotationHandler for extension schema annotation compatibility check.
The new handler implements 'checkCompatibility' method, which introduces specific rules for extension annotation compatibility check.
Test:
unit tests
manual test.

beforeCommit.message: Add PegasusExtensionSchemaAnnotationHandler for extension schema annotation compatibility check

afterCommit.message: Add PegasusExtensionSchemaAnnotationHandler for extension schema annotation compatibility check

nodes.bodyText:
I am wondering if it could be written into a single
if ... else if ... block
instead of two if blocks
Because that way, we will get to know this two logic are meant for output just one thing:
a pathspec to checkerContext map
And looks like the last part can be the else part of the logic

nit: Wonder how do you feel about make it less lengthy:
PegasusExtensionSchemaAnnotationHandler -> ExtensionSchemaAnnotationHandler
As a code review, I usually hope the code is readable, but also compact.
I think Pegasus is being a bit extra since we know where we are.
Just a nit suggestion!

nodes.bodyText: There are other definition of EXTENSION_ANNOTATION_NAMESPACE, please just make it one, and compact. It can be public, since it is final, nobody is able to change it. Also the lesser the defined string the more efficient memory use.

+  private final String EXTENSION_ANNOTATION_NAMESPACE = "extension";

nodes.bodyText:
The semantic of the function name makes me believe it is actually doing some resolving action, it will be less expected to just return the a default ResolutionResult class instance.
If we want an instance of ResolutionResult, we can use other naming.
If we make EXTENSION_ANNOTATION_NAMESPACE compact (just one place has it) and public (because it is finalized) maybe we can save this function.
So I guess right now this class is just a place holder?
Wonder if we can change prevResolvedProperties to snapshot...properties, because it is actually from the snapshot.

The above logic only has 1 ANNOTATION_COMPATIBLE_CHANGE impact, all the other impact are incompatible.
I wonder how is it better if split into two results (or just one result if you dont care comptaible message, btw why do we need compatible message?)
If we split to two results, and you can add all incompatible msg to a dedicated result. That will make these callers that are saving msg not need to pass the CompatibilityMessage.Impact.ANNOTATION_INCOMPATIBLE_CHANGE and less repeating ourselves.
